message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.DC, cs.SY

Reasoning: 
1. cs.LG (Machine Learning): The paper proposes a framework for distributed Bayesian learning using Mean Field Variational Bayes (MFVB) for distributed Matrix Factorization (MF) and affine structure from motion (SfM). This falls under the domain of machine learning and hence, cs.LG is the most likely sub-category.
2. cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence): The paper proposes a framework for probabilistic modelling of complex datasets using Bayesian models. This falls under the domain of artificial intelligence and hence, cs.AI is also a likely sub-category.
3. cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition): The paper demonstrates the utility of the proposed framework for distributed affine structure from motion (SfM), which is a computer vision problem. Hence, cs.CV is also a likely sub-category.
4. cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing): The paper proposes a distributed algorithm for Bayesian learning, which involves both data and computation being distributed across the nodes of the network. Hence, cs.DC is also a likely sub-category.
5. cs.SY (Systems and Control): The paper proposes a framework for distributed Bayesian learning, which can be applied to various systems and control problems. Hence, cs.SY is also a likely sub-category.
